Title.En: Play as a pedagogical resource to support children´s development, learning and creativity

Description.En:
In this module, play is treated as a central part of childhood and it is described from different research-based perspectives. Play is also related to teachers’ mission to stimulate creativity, learning and development and promote social community between children. Furthermore, how teachers can create environments for play is discussed, as well as the pedagogical potential in play as a way to interact and communicate. The module develops upon a childhood sociological perspective, including concepts such as children's perspectives and children's agency.

The module will start with online activities that will provide the theoretical background in play as a pedagogical resource. During the face-to-face week at Linköping University, campus Norrköping (12-16 May 2025), you will have the opportunity to meet peers and par­ticipate in interactive activities. Vari­ous play situations, including both outdoor and indoor play, will be explored. Site visits to early-childhood and extended education centers are planned, along with excursions to both the forest and the city of Norrköping. Students will also employ their different backgrounds to inform discussions about play.

This module is an excellent choice for students of teaching programmes and for students of other disciplines that are curious about how play can stimulate creativity and learning in their filed.

NoteLiteral.En: The ability to describe children's play based on different approaches and theories
Ability to discuss pedagogical organisation of play based on research.
Ability to explain how teachers can create conditions for play and use play as an educational resource.

Title.En: Play as a pedagogical resource to support children´s development, learning and creativity
Play as a pedagogical resource to support children´s development, learning and creativity

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
This module includes a mandatory mobility 12-16 May 2025. Please contact the ECIU mobility officer at your home university to secure mobility funding for this micro-module.

We will make sure that you are notified regarding your admission in good time to allow you to plan your trip.

**Schedule**

The introduction and first meeting of the module will take place ***online on 31 March (exact time TBA)***.

The learners will receive a detailed schedule of the online activities in due course.

**Face-to-face week**

Below you can see a preliminary programme for the F2F week 12-16 May 2025. Changes may occur:

The module starts on 12 May at 9:00  in the Norrköping campus, Linköping University, and ends on 16 May at 13:00. The week will include literature seminars, workshops, and presentations. The schedule also includes visits to a preschool and an school-age educare center, as well as practical play seminars outdoors in both a park and a forest.

**Monday 12 May**

- 9:00: Introduction
- 10:00 Seminar: What is play? Personal experiences
- 13:00 Practical seminar: play in Folkparken

**Tuesday 13 May**

- 9:00 Visit to preschool facility
- 13:00 Litterature seminar: Corsaro

**Wednesday 14 May**

- 9:00 Workshop at play lab
- 13:00 Visit to school-age educar

**Thursday 15 May**

- 9:00 Practical seminar: play in Vrinneviskogen
- 13:00 Preparare presentation

**Friday 16 May**

- 9:00 Presentation
- 13:00 Conclusion

**Examination**

The module is examined through written and oral presentation.

For any questions, please contact us at eciu@liu.se.
Join us in exploring the great learning potential of play and make a difference in children´s education.

Bring yourself back to your childhood. Do you remember how happy you felt when you were playing? And how many things you learned from that? This module highlights the centrality of play in childhood and the ways it encourages creativity, learning development and social community among children. The module will start with online activities where the theoretical foundations of play as a pedagogical resource will be laid down. During the face-to-face week, you will meet peers and participate in different play situations, both indoors and outdoors. Site visits and excursions are also planned.

**Deadline for applications**: 02 March 2025

**Entry requirements**: studying at the university level

**Mobility Grant**: Please contact the ECIU mobility officer as soon as possible to find out if you are eligible for a mobility grant

**Supporting documentation**

All applicants are required to submit a transcript of records.

To process your application we will need the following infromation:

- Name
- Surname
- Legal sex (female/male)
- Date of birth
- Valid home address
- Phone number

This is necessary for the activation of your account at Linköping University and to get access to the study material and the learning management system. Please fill in the above information in your profile on the ECIU engage platform, it will make the process much easier and faster for everyone.

You will receive a results notification within 2 days from the application deadline. If you are admitted, you will be contacted by the host university regarding the next steps in the process.
